subject: Home & DIY
title: The Hidden Cost of Heating Water
description: One-minute skill: The Hidden Cost of Heating Water.

hook.text: Water heating is the second-largest energy expense in most homesâ€”about 18% of your utility bill, after space heating.

buildup.text: Tank heaters keep 40-80 gallons hot 24/7, even at 3 AM when nobody's using water. That's constant energy waste.

discovery.text: Tankless heaters only fire when a tap opens. No standby loss means 24-34% less energy for typical households.

twist.text: Heat pump water heaters are even betterâ€”they pull heat from surrounding air. They cut water heating costs by up to 65%.

climax.text: A four-minute shorter shower saves more yearly energy than switching every bulb to LED. Behavior beats technology.

punchline.text: Your longest shower costs more than your longest movie.
